newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq slips from record streak in heavy trading.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq slips from record streak in heavy trading.

text.p: Weak results at a Treasury auction and late sell programs hammered Nasdaq shares down from a record high in late trading, traders said.
The Nasdaq Composite Index lost 9.71 point to close unofficially at 1378.35 on heavy volume of 811 million shares -- the second highest volume ever.
Nasdaq index hit a record high of 1400.53 around 1345 EST/1845 GMT. Shares started to slid at about 1445 EST/1945 GMT, gaining speed near the close.
Traders said stocks started to slip after an auction in the Treasury market failed to meet expectations.
Late in the day, sell programs also hammered the Dow Industrials down 94 points to close unofficially at about 6756. The long bond dropped 8/32 to yield 6.86 percent.
The continued decline in International Business Machines Corp also pushed some blue chip technology stocks lower.

Microsoft Corp lost 2-5/8 to 94-3/4. Intel Corp fell 3/8 to 151-3/4 and Oracle Corp slipped 1-7/8 to 40-1/2. Dell Computer Corp and other personal computer makers, however, gained on an upbeat outlook for 1997.
